lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court ruling on a restrictive Texas law allows 10 clinics to remain open, while giving abortion providers and advocates their biggest win in a three-year legal fight.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Houston, and Abby Goodnough from Washington. David Montgomery contributed reporting from Austin, Tex.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and ABBY GOODNOUGH

snippet: The Supreme Court ruling on a restrictive Texas law allows 10 clinics to remain open, while giving abortion providers and advocates their biggest win in a three-year legal fight.
abstract: Abortion-rights advocates are relieved and encouraged by Supreme Court decision overturning Texas' 2013 laws regulating practice; many are expecting shuttered clinics to reopen and are bracing for Republican lawmakers' response to ruling.
